ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A general purpose toolbox for personality, psychometric theory and experimental psychology.   Functions are primarily for multivariate analysis and scale construction using factor analysis, principal component analysis, cluster analysis and reliability analysis, although others provide basic descriptive statistics. Item Response Theory is done using  factor analysis of tetrachoric and polychoric correlations. Functions for analyzing data at multiple levels include within and between group statistics, including correlations and factor analysis.   Functions for simulating and testing particular item and test structures are included. Several functions  serve as a useful front end for structural equation modeling.  Graphical displays of path diagrams, factor analysis and structural equation models are created using basic graphics. Some of the functions are written to support a book on psychometric theory as well as publications in personality research. For more information, see the <https://personality-project.org/r> web page.

A general purpose toolbox for personality, psychometric theory and experimental psychology.   Functions are primarily for multivariate analysis and scale construction using factor analysis, principal component analysis, cluster analysis and reliability analysis, although others provide basic descriptive statistics. Item Response Theory is done using  factor analysis of tetrachoric and polychoric correlations. Functions for analyzing data at multiple levels include within and between group statistics, including correlations and factor analysis.   Functions for simulating and testing particular item and test structures are included. Several functions  serve as a useful front end for structural equation modeling.  Graphical displays of path diagrams, factor analysis and structural equation models are created using basic graphics. Some of the functions are written to support a book on psychometric theory as well as publications in personality research. For more information, see the <https://personality-project.org/r> web page.

name: r-psych
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.6.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-psych
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/psych_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/psych/psych_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d0629626f01baa705beffbfd55e14229a16c4875b21b6992d787bb560e9e11f8

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-gparotation
    - r-lattice
    - r-mnormt
    - r-nlme
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-gparotation
    - r-lattice
    - r-mnormt
    - r-nlme

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('psych')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('psych')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://personality-project.org/r/psych https://personality-project.org/r/psych-manual.pdf
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: A general purpose toolbox for personality, psychometric theory and experimental psychology.   Functions are primarily for multivariate analysis and scale construction using factor analysis, principal component analysis, cluster analysis and reliability analysis, although others provide basic descriptive 
    statistics. Item Response Theory is done using  factor analysis of tetrachoric and polychoric correlations. Functions for analyzing data at multiple levels include within and between group statistics, including correlations and factor analysis.   Functions for simulating and testing particular item and test 
    structures are included. Several functions  serve as a useful front end for structural equation modeling.  Graphical displays of path diagrams, factor analysis and structural equation models are created using basic graphics. Some of the functions are written to support a book on psychometric theory as well as 
    publications in personality research. For more information, see the <https://personality-project.org/r> web page.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: psych
# Version: 1.9.12
# Date: 2019-12-14
# Title: Procedures for Psychological, Psychometric, and Personality Research
# Authors@R: person("William", "Revelle", role =c("aut","cre"), email="revelle@northwestern.edu", comment=c(ORCID  = "0000-0003-4880-9610") )
# Description: A general purpose toolbox for personality, psychometric theory and experimental psychology.   Functions are primarily for multivariate analysis and scale construction using factor analysis, principal component analysis, cluster analysis and reliability analysis, although others provide basic descriptive statistics. Item Response Theory is done using  factor analysis of tetrachoric and polychoric correlations. Functions for analyzing data at multiple levels include within and between group statistics, including correlations and factor analysis.   Functions for simulating and testing particular item and test structures are included. Several functions  serve as a useful front end for structural equation modeling.  Graphical displays of path diagrams, factor analysis and structural equation models are created using basic graphics. Some of the functions are written to support a book on psychometric theory as well as publications in personality research. For more information, see the <https://personality-project.org/r> web page.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# Imports: mnormt,parallel,stats,graphics,grDevices,methods,foreign,lattice,nlme
# Suggests: GPArotation, lavaan, sem, lme4,Rcsdp, graph, Rgraphviz,psychTools
# LazyData: yes
# ByteCompile: TRUE
# URL: https://personality-project.org/r/psych https://personality-project.org/r/psych-manual.pdf
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-12-15 20:23:29 UTC; WR
# Author: William Revelle [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4880-9610>)
# Maintainer: William Revelle <revelle@northwestern.edu>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-12-20 16:40:02 UTC
